0.header: JUpiter ICy moons Explorer (JUICE): An ESA mission to orbit Ganymede and to characterise the Jupiter system
0.comment: The detailed investigation of three of Jupiter's Galilean satellites (Ganymede, Europa, and Callisto) is central to elucidating the conditions for habitability of icy worlds

0.header: Mars Global Surveyor - MOLA video : Martian Topography
0.comment: The Mars Observer Laser Altimeter (MOLA) instrument on NASA's Mars Global Surveyor produced the best map of Martian topography to date. Elevations are shown by colors - 'sea level' lies where yellow turns to green - while MOLA data and shading reveal the planet's basins, volcanos and valleys. Video from the Arizona State University

0.header: Mars Global Surveyor  - Movie: Global Data
0.comment: Mars Global Datasets Tour: The Data in the video show the telescopic view of Mars from Earth, the planet's albedo (brightness), its color, its topography, its ancient magnetism, its abundance of elemental potassium, its thermal inertia, and its global mineralogy. Then the scene zooms in, eventually stopping at Syrtis Major, a large, low volcano. Video from the Arizona State University.

0.comment: A key MESSENGER design element deals with the intense heat at Mercury. The Sun is up to 11 times brighter than we see on Earth and surface temperatures can reach 450 degrees Celsius (about 840 degrees Fahrenheit), but MESSENGER will operate at room temperature behind a sunshade made of heat-resistant ceramic cloth.

component.name: Infrared sensor

component.description: Instruments used  to measure the magnetization of a magnetic material or to measure the strength and the direction of the magnetic field.
component.name: Magnetic fields metrics

component.description: Seize microwave section of EM-spectre
component.name: Microwave sensor

component.description: Collect Data about different kinds of particles, from protons to smaller ones.
component.name: Particles Detector

component.description: Analyze and collect data about ionized gases.
component.name: Plasma Analyzer

component.description: Works everywhere, but it is radioactive.
component.name: Primary Power RTG

component.description: The closer to the Sun, the better! But, they work even quite far away.
component.name: Primary Power Solar Arrays

component.description: Impulsive propulsion that always works, but costs more for long missions.
component.name: Propulsion Chemical

component.description: Super cool, but right now it works good only if you accept long mission times or high power.
component.name: Propulsion Electric

component.description: Similar to the optical sensor, but on different wavelenghts.
component.name: Radio Sensor

component.description: Keeps it all together at a 'low' cost, but might not be enough for highly-debris-populated zones. Radiation shielding might be a problem.
component.name: Standard Structure

component.description: It can be sent on celestial bodies to collect samples and analyze them.
component.name: Surface & atmosphere probe

component.description: It allows a wider temperature range, but it needs power.
component.name: Thermal Active

component.description: Doesn't consume any power, but cannot be used everywhere.
component.name: Thermal Passive

component.description: Seizeultraviolet
component.name: Ultraviolet sensor

component.description: It's like a camera, but in space! Seize the visible light.
component.name: Visible Light Sensor

component.description: Seize X-rays
component.name: X-rays sensor

0.header: Rosetta - Mission Facts 2 - Mission Timeline : JPL website

component.description: A laser altimeter is an instrument that measures the distance from an orbiting spacecraft to the surface of the planet or asteroid.
component.name: Altitude metrics (laser)

component.description: Whenever you need to amplify a signal, whichever it is.
component.name: Amplifier

component.description: You wanna point an ant 1000 km away? You can, but is resource-consuming.
component.name: AODCS Robust

component.description: Use gravity and spinning to stabilize your spacecraft for free. Pointing is not that accurate.
component.name: AODCS Simple

component.description: Always good and cheap, but low specific energy.
component.name: Backup Power Batteries

component.description: Always good and good specific energy, but not that cheap.
component.name: Backup Power Fuel Cells

component.description: Optimized high-cost protocols and algorithms for a proper data handling.
component.name: Command and Data Handling Optimized

component.description: 'Low'cost protocols that are not optimized.
component.name: Command and Data Handling Standard

component.description: Consumes less power, but it must be pointed.
component.name: Communication Monodirectional

component.description: No pointing needed! Higher power required though...
component.name: Communication Omnidirectional

component.description: Seize Gamma-rays
component.name: Gamma-rays sensor

component.description: A gravitational-wave detector is any device designed to measure gravitational waves, tiny distortions of spacetime.
component.name: Gravitational wave detector

component.description: It's like a bunker, but much more lighter and in space (so it is expensive)!
